eb5f6996-4bd2-4280-bb17-7b68a6ce3880 AtkinsRéalis unveils new advanced Candu designThe 1000 MW Candu Monark, a Generation III+ reactor with the highest output of any Candu technology, is currently in the definition phase, the company said at the <em>巴黎世界核展览会，将以简化的结构和 70 年的使用寿命为特色。; Tue, 28 Nov 2023 16:35:15 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/AtkinsRealis-unveils-new-advanced-Candu-design?feed=feed
13b44557-6abf-4ef0-b8a6-33d0fb2e9c54 Orano packaging model receives US approvalThe US Nuclear Regulatory Commission has approved Orano's TN Eagle nuclear packaging model for the transport and dry storage of used fuel. Tue, 28 Nov 2023 17:08:55 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Orano-packaging-model-receives-US-approval?feed=feed
0fb60535-ec3f-4193-937d-fc23293ee50b Large module installed at Lianjiang 1The CA20 module is 20.6 metres long, 14.2 metres wide and 21 metres high and weighs just over 1000 tonnes. It was hoisted into place in the first unit of the Guangdong Lianjiang Nuclear Power Project in a near-four hour operation. Tue, 28 Nov 2023 15:35:34 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Large-module-installed-at-Lianjiang-1?feed=feed
ad9729d1-a874-4d1f-bfa4-6fd2706b0863 Saskatchewan government announces microreactor fundingThe province is providing CAD80 million (USD59 million) for the Saskatchewan Research Council to pursue the demonstration of a microreactor in Saskatchewan, with plans for a Westinghouse-designed eVinci micoreactor to be operational in the province from 2029. Mon, 27 Nov 2023 15:58:38 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Saskatchewan-government-announces-microreactor-fun?feed=feed
46d3bf47-187d-458b-a08d-58e434a7b52e Chinese long-distance nuclear heating project begins operationChina's first project to bring nuclear-generated heat to multiple prefecture-level cities has begun operation in Shandong province, supplying heat from the Haiyang nuclear power plant to the cities of Haiyang and Rushan through a 23 km pipeline. Mon, 27 Nov 2023 14:32:58 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Chinese-long-distance-nuclear-heating-project-begi?feed=feed
9f06140d-5d80-405b-9011-0dd3c8af41b1 Second large Polish nuclear plant gets approvalPoland's Ministry of Climate and Environment has issued a decision-in-principle for the country's second large nuclear power plant. Two South Korean-supplied APR1400 reactors are planned in the Patnów-Konin region. Mon, 27 Nov 2023 13:25:38 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Second-large-Polish-nuclear-plant-gets-approval?feed=feed
b8844839-b3d1-42d8-a875-c3c714ff8b3d IAEA reports rockets fired from near Zaporizhzhia plantInternational Atomic Energy Agency staff at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant say they heard what sounded like rockets "fired from a Multiple Launch Rocket System nearby" - it came on the same day the site lost connection to its main off-site power line. Mon, 27 Nov 2023 13:20:51 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/IAEA-reports-rockets-fired-from-near-Zaporizhzhia?feed=feed
cd3b5420-89fe-4874-a259-5be479675dc6 IAEA finds commitment to safety at Russian fast reactorAn International Atomic Energy Agency team of experts have reviewed operational safety at unit 4 of Russia's Beloyarsk nuclear power plant. It marks the first Operational Safety Review Team mission to a fast neutron reactor. Fri, 24 Nov 2023 14:32:41 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/IAEA-finds-commitment-to-safety-at-Russian-fast-re?feed=feed
2d1de023-bf35-4838-a93b-a0b3032abcc9 Bruce completes largest-to-date radioisotope deliveryOctober's harvest of cobalt-60, used worldwide to sterilise medical equipment, was the largest since the company began producing the isotope in the 1980s and included two shipments of medical-grade material for therapeutic use. Fri, 24 Nov 2023 13:41:22 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Bruce-completes-largest-to-date-radioisotope-deliv?feed=feed

5d554e34-1296-4b87-8d53-44b2e746567b Hungary to consider alternative sources for nuclear fuelThe Hungarian Parliament has reportedly supported an amendment to the country's nuclear energy policy that would allow alternative sources to be used for fuel for the Paks nuclear power plant, which has until now relied on Russian-supplied fuel.
